SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

xxl.core.collections.queues
Class ArrayQueue<E>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.collections.queues.AbstractQueue<E>
      xxl.core.collections.queues.ArrayQueue<E>
Type Parameters:
E - the type of the elements of this queue.
All Implemented Interfaces:
FIFOQueue<E>, Queue<E>
public class ArrayQueue<E>
extends AbstractQueue<E>
implements FIFOQueue<E>

This class provides a resizable-array implementation of the Queue interface with a FIFO (first in, first out) strategy. It implements the peek method. In addition to implementing the Queue interface, this class provides methods to directly access the array that is internally used to store the data.

Each ArrayQueue instance has a capacity. The capacity is the size of the array used to store the elements in the queue. It is always at least as large as the queue size. When elements are inserted into an ArrayQueue, its capacity may grow automatically. The details of the growth policy are specified by the ArrayResizer.

The array is used as a circular storage for the queue to avoid the shift of the whole queue when the first element is removed. Therefore a field is needed to store the index of the first element in the array.

Example usage (1). 

     // create a new array
 
     Integer[] array = new Integer[] {
         new Integer(1),
         new Integer(2),
         new Integer(3),
         new Integer(4),
         new Integer(5)
     };
 
     // create a new array queue with the given array
 
     ArrayQueue<Integer> queue = new ArrayQueue<Integer>(array);
                
     // open the queue
     
     queue.open();
 
     // print all elements of the queue
 
     while (!queue.isEmpty())
         System.out.println(queue.dequeue());
     
     System.out.println();
  
     // close the open queue after use
 
     queue.close();
Example usage (2). 
     // create a new array queue with the first three elements of the given array
 
     queue = new ArrayQueue<Integer>(3, array);
 
     // open the queue
     
     queue.open();
 
     // print all elements of the queue
 
     while (!queue.isEmpty())
         System.out.println(queue.dequeue());
 
     System.out.println();
 
     // close the open queue after use
 
      queue.close();
Example usage (3). 
     // create a new iterator containing the elements of the given array
 
     Cursor<Integer> cursor = new ArrayCursor<Integer>(array);
 
     // create a new empty array queue
 
     queue = new ArrayQueue<Integer>();

     // open the queue
     
     queue.open();
 
     for (; cursor.hasNext(); queue.enqueue(cursor.next()));

     // print all elements of the queue

     while (!queue.isEmpty())
          System.out.println(queue.dequeue());

     System.out.println();
 
     // close the open queue and cursor after use
 
     queue.close();
     cursor.close();
Example usage (4). 
     // create a new empty queue with a growth policy managed by new ArrayResizer(0.5, 0.6, 0.4)
 
     queue = new ArrayQueue<Integer>(0.5, 0.6, 0.4);
 
     // open the queue
     
     queue.open();
 
     // insert and remove 20 elements and print after each operation the size of the queue and
     // the internally used array
 
     System.out.println("queue.size()="+queue.size()+" & "
                        +"queue.array.length="+queue.array.length);
     for (int i = 1; i < 21; i++) {
         queue.enqueue(new Integer(i));
         System.out.println("queue.size()="+queue.size()+" & "
                             +"queue.array.length="+queue.array.length);
     }
     while (!queue.isEmpty()) {
         queue.dequeue();
         System.out.println("queue.size()="+queue.size()+" & "
                            +"queue.array.length="+queue.array.length);
     }
 
     System.out.println();
     
      // close the open queue after use
 
      queue.close();

See Also:
Queue, AbstractQueue, FIFOQueue, ArrayResizer

Field Detail

resizer

protected ArrayResizer resizer
An ArrayResizer managing the growth policy for the internally used array. The ArrayResizer decides before an insertion or after an removal of an element whether the array has to be resized or not.

See Also:
ArrayResizer

array

protected Object[] array
The array is internally used to store the elements of the queue. Before an insertion and after the removal of an element this array is automatically resized by an ArrayResizer.

first

protected int first
An int field storing the index of the first element of the queue in the array.

Constructor Detail

ArrayQueue

public ArrayQueue(int size,
                  E[] array,
                  double fmin,
                  double fover,
                  double funder)
           throws IllegalArgumentException
Constructs a queue containing the elements of the specified array with a growth polity that depends on the specified double parameters. The field array is set to the specified array, the field size is set to the specified size and the field resizer (growth policy) is initialized by the constructor ArrayResizer(fmin, fover, funder).

Parameters:
size - the number of elements of the specified array which should be used to initialize the internally used array.
array - the object array that is used to initialize the internally used array.
fmin - a control parameter for the growth policy.
fover - a control parameter for the growth policy.
funder - a control parameter for the growth policy.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the specified size argument is negative, or if it is greater than the length of the specified array.
See Also:
ArrayResizer.ArrayResizer(double, double, double)

ArrayQueue

public ArrayQueue(E[] array,
                  double fmin,
                  double fover,
                  double funder)
Constructs a queue containing the elements of the specified array with a growth polity that depends on the specified double parameters. This constructor is equivalent to the call of ArrayQueue(array.length, array, fmin, fover, funder).

Parameters:
array - the object array that is used to initialize the internally used array.
fmin - a control parameter for the growth policy.
fover - a control parameter for the growth policy.
funder - a control parameter for the growth policy.

ArrayQueue

public ArrayQueue(double fmin,
                  double fover,
                  double funder)
Constructs an empty queue with a growth policy that depends on the specified double parameters. This constructor is equivalent to the call of ArrayQueue(0, new Object[0], fmin, fover, funder).

Parameters:
fmin - a control parameter for the growth policy.
fover - a control parameter for the growth policy.
funder - a control parameter for the growth policy.

Parameters:
array - the object array that is used to initialize the internally used array.

ArrayQueue

public ArrayQueue()
Constructs an empty queue. This constructor is equivalent to the call of ArrayQueue(0, new Object[0]).

Method Detail

enqueueObject

protected void enqueueObject(E object)
Appends the specified element to the end of this queue. Before the element is inserted the internally used array may be resized automatically depending on its growth policy.

Specified by:
enqueueObject in class AbstractQueue<E>
Parameters:
object - element to be appended to the end of this queue.

peekObject

protected E peekObject()
Returns the next element in the queue without removing it. The next element is the value of the component of the internally used array which is pointed by the index first.

Specified by:
peekObject in class AbstractQueue<E>
Returns:
the next element in the queue.

dequeueObject

protected E dequeueObject()
Returns the next element in the queue (and removes it). The next element is the value of the component of the internally used array which is pointed by the index first.

Specified by:
dequeueObject in class AbstractQueue<E>
Returns:
the next element in the queue.

clear

public void clear()
Removes all elements from this queue. The queue will be empty after this call returns so that size() == 0.
The internally used array will be replaced by an empty array and the fields size and first will be set to 0.

Specified by:
clear in interface Queue<E>
Overrides:
clear in class AbstractQueue<E>

main

public static void main(String[] args)
The main method contains some examples how to use an ArrayQueue. It can also be used to test the functionality of an ArrayQueue.

Parameters:
args - array of String arguments. It can be used to submit parameters when the main method is called.
